title: Add member registration option (new section + navigation)

requirements.text: Add a new single-page section for member registration, reachable via a header navigation item, using an on-page registration form (frontend-only UI).
acceptanceCriteria: A new section exists in the main page flow with a stable anchor id (e.g., "member-registration").
Site header navigation includes a new item (label in English) that smooth-scrolls to the member registration section on desktop and mobile menus.
The new section is rendered from App.tsx in the correct order alongside existing sections.
All user-facing text introduced by this feature is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the member registration form UI with client-side validation and a clear disclaimer that submissions are not delivered/saved yet (no backend integration).
acceptanceCriteria: The form includes, at minimum: Full name, Phone number, Email (optional), District/State, and a short "Why do you want to join?" message.
Client-side validation blocks submission when required fields are missing and shows an error toast/message in English.
On successful simulated submission, show an English success toast/message and reset the form fields.
A visible disclaimer in English states that this is a demo form and submissions are not currently delivered or stored.
No calls are made to the Motoko backend actor for this form.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).

Do not edit immutable hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; only add backend logic if explicitly required (this request does not require it).
nonGoals: Implementing backend persistence for member registrations.
Adding third-party authentication or sign-in beyond existing Internet Identity plumbing.
